snippet: A business owner and a homeowner, among others, are losing their properties near the Barclays Center in Brooklyn to the development, now called Pacific Park.
abstract: The Appraisal column; Aaron Piller, president of Atlantic Wool company, is one of several property owners ordered by New York State Supreme Court to leave home near Barclays Center to make way for second phase of development project now known as Pacific Park; is angry that compensation offer from Empire State Development, agency handling eminent domain proceedings, is lower than that originally tendered by developer Forest City.
lead_paragraph: A business owner and a homeowner, among others, are losing their properties near the Barclays Center in Brooklyn to the development, now called Pacific Park.

headline.print_headline: At Atlantic Yards Site, the Last Holdouts Must Now Leave
headline.main: In Arena’s Shadow, Holdouts at Atlantic Yards Site Must Now Leave
